segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation:
BGM, A segment by means of which the sender must uniquely identify the PAYMUL message using its type and number and when necessary its function.
Note: The identification will be passed back to the ordering customer for reconciliation purposes, if a reference is not quoted in the B- level.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and if required the time when the message is created.

segment.name: Business function
segment.documentation: BUS, A segment providing information to the ordered bank to route the message, or for tariffing or for the provision of some statistical information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying any previously sent message.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment specifying the reference number of another message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment identifying the creation date of the referenced message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the financial institutions involved in the multiple payment order and the routing functions with their contacts.

segment.name: Financial institution information
segment.documentation: FII, A segment identifying the financial institutions associated with the transaction in coded or uncoded form and their function.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment identifying a person or department for the party specified in the leading FII segment and to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment providing communication type(s) and number(s) of person(s) or department(s) specified in the associated CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments identifying the ordering party, which is valid for all payment orders.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, Name and address for the ordering customer.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment identifying a portion or a department for the party specified in the leading NAD segment to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment identifying communication type(s) and number(s) of person(s) or department(s) specified in the associated CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: SG11 This segment group contains information regarding the debit side of this transaction and details which are pertinent to all payments specified in the message. Certain payment details may be provided either in segment group 4 or in segment group 11, but not in both.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the line item by a current line number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment identifying the date, at which an order has been requested to be executed or acted upon.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation:
RFF, A segment specifying the reference of the single debit amount on the debit side of the Transaction (B level).
Note: The identification will be passed back to the Ordering Customer for reconciliation purposes.

segment.name: Business function
segment.documentation: BUS, A segment identifying certain characteristics of the payment orders stored on level C, such as business function.

segment.name: Financial charges allocation
segment.documentation: FCA, A segment specifying the method for allocation of charges and allowances (e.g. charges to be borne by the ordering customer), and identifying the ordering customer's account to which such charges or allowances should be directed where it is different from the principal account. This constitutes a default specification and may be overridden at detail level.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments containing the currency of the single amounts in level C, currency to be transferred, plus the total of all single amounts of level C.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the total amount and the currency to be transferred.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment specifying the source currency and the destination currency of the transaction, when they are different. The rate of exchange is solely used when previously agreed between the ordering customer and the ordered bank.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment identifying the effective date and/or time the rate of exchange was fixed. The other occurrence identifies the reference date.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the deal between ordered bank and ordering customer.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments containing an account servicing bank including the account to be debited. Another occurrence can be used to specify the account for the return of unsuccessful transactions. If the ordering party is not quoted separately in the NAD-segment on level-B or level-A, then this group also contains the information of the ordering party.

segment.name: Financial institution information
segment.documentation: FII, A segment identifying the financial institution and relevant account number with the currency.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment identifying a person or a department for the financial institution specified in the FII segment and to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment providing a communication number for the party identified in the FII segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments identifying the ordering party mutually exclusive with NAD-segment on level-A for the ordering party (Ordering customer and payor). Furthermore, one contact party can also be quoted in this group.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying the name and address of the non- financial institutions associated with the PAYMUL.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment identifying a person or a department for the party specified in the NAD segment and to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment providing a communication number for the party identified in the NAD segment and optionally for the contact identified in the associated CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments containing instructions from the ordering customer relating to parties identified in the NAD and FII segments. It specifies action to be taken by the identified parties and the date (and optionally time) by which such action needs to be taken.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment identifying the party originating the instruction and the parties to be contacted. It specifies where appropriate the instruction in coded form.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment providing free text instruction relating to the associated INP segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the earliest and the latest dates and times by which the instruction specified in the INP and/or FTX segment(s) needs to be carried out.

segmentGroup.documentation:
Segment group 9: A group of segments providing information for subsequent use by regulatory authorities requiring statistical and other types of data. It also identifies the regulatory authority for which the information is intended followed by the information itself.
This group is mutually exclusive with Segment Group 15.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment identifying what processing should be completed by regulatory authorities.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment giving the amount and the currency of each transaction to be reported.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving the different origins/destinations (places) of goods/investment/services.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying a party related to the associated informative text.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment giving the nature (e.g. goods, transport services) and direction of each transaction to be recorded in coded form.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment giving information in coded or in clear form to provide information relevant to regulatory authorities requirements.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments - mutually exclusive with level -C- containing the details of payment, which are determined for all payments on level C.

segment.name: Process identification
segment.documentation: PRC, A segment identifying the kind of free text following this segment.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment for information in coded or in clear form to provide information from the ordering customer to the beneficiary.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: SG14-SG15-SG16 This segment group contains information regarding the Beneficiaries of the payments. Certain payment details may be provided either in segment group 11 or in segment group 4, but not in both.

segment.name: Sequence details
segment.documentation: SEQ, A segment identifying the beginning of the credit side of the transaction (C level) by a sequential number, which may also be used for reconciliation purposes.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment giving the amount value of the payment. It is the amount to be transferred. The currency is quoted on the debit side of the transaction (level B).

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment identifying date(s)/time(s) related to the beneficiary's side.

segment.name: Business function
segment.documentation: BUS, A segment identifying business information (per credit) for the payment order.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying a transaction from the ordering customer to the beneficiary and/or from the ordering customer to the ordered bank.

segment.name: Payment instructions
segment.documentation: PAI, A segment specifying the conditions, method and channel of payment for the payment order.

segment.name: Financial charges allocation
segment.documentation: FCA, A segment specifying the method for allocation of charges and allowances and identifying the ordering customer's account to which such charges or allowances should be directed where it is different from the principal amount. This segment is mutually exclusive with the FCA segment in Segment Group 4.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments containing the beneficiary's bank and the account and if necessary up to two intermediary banks.

segment.name: Financial institution information
segment.documentation: FII, A segment identifying the financial institution and relevant account number with the currency.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment identifying a person or a department for the financial institution specified in the FII segment and to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment providing a communication number for the party identified in the FII Segment and optionally for the intermediary banks.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments identifying the name and address of the beneficiary and one contact party.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying the name and address of the non- financial institutions associated with the payment on the beneficiary's side.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment identifying a person or a department for the party specified in the NAD segment and to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment providing a communication number for the party identified in the NAD segment and optionally for the contact identified in the associated CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments containing instructions from the ordering customer relating to parties identified in the NAD and FII segments. It specifies action to be taken by the identified parties and the date (and optionally time) by which such action needs to be taken.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment identifying the party originating the instruction and the parties to be contacted. It specifies where appropriate the instruction in coded form.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment providing free text instruction relating to the associated INP segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the earliest and the latest dates and times by which the instruction specified in the INP and/or FTX segment(s) needs to be carried out.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments providing information for subsequent use by regulatory authorities requiring statistical and other types of data. It also identifies the regulatory authority for which the information is intended followed by the information itself.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment identifying what processing should be completed by regulatory authorities.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment giving the amount and the currency of each transaction to be reported.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving the different origins/destinations (places) of goods/investment/services.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying the recipient of the associated informative text.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment giving the nature (e.g. goods, transport services) and direction of each transaction to be recorded in coded form.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment giving information in coded or in clear form to provide information relevant to regulatory authorities' requirements.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments containing the details of payment. The content of these segments is passed through the banking chain from the ordering customer to the beneficiary.

segment.name: Process identification
segment.documentation: PRC, A segment identifying the kind of payment details.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment providing free text instruction relating to the payment details.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments providing details of all documents, e.g., invoices, statements, despatch advices, etc..., to which the Multiple Payment Order refers. It includes information on the monetary amounts for each document and on any adjustments (with an indication of the reason for adjustments) and discounts. For information purposes an indication of the tax element can be provided.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying the reference document against which payment is being made.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment giving the monetary amounts of each reference document (e.g., original amount, discount amount etc..). The amount due and the amount remitted are mandatory.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date of the referenced document and indicating any other relevant dates applicable.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any additional references related to the reference document.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying a party name and address, either by coded identification or in a clear form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments specifying the currencies and the related dates/periods valid to the referenced document where different to the reference currency.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currency and associated exchange rate of the referenced document where different to the remittance currency.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments indicating adjustment amounts and their referenced documents.

segment.name: Adjustment details
segment.documentation: AJT, A segment indicating any adjustments to the amounts originally specified in the referenced document, and to which items such adjustments apply with the associated reason for adjustment.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment giving the monetary amounts of the adjustments of each reference document (e.g. original amounts, discount amount, etc.) The currency data elements should not be used.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any additional references related to the reference documents.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment providing free text information related to the payment details.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments which may be used when required to provide details of individual line items in the reference document.

segment.name: Document line identification
segment.documentation: DLI, A segment identifying a specific line item within the referenced document.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment giving the monetary amounts for this line item.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment specifying item identification codes where required.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the line item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments identifying the currency and the related dates/periods of the line item where different to the remittance and document currency.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currency and associated exchange rate of the line item, where different to the reference and target currency.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the effective date and/or time the rate of exchange was fixed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments indicating adjustment amounts and their referenced documents for this line item.

segment.name: Adjustment details
segment.documentation: AJT, A segment indicating any adjustments to the amounts originally specified for this line item and the reason for the adjustments.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment giving the monetary amounts of the adjustment for this line item.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any additional references related to the reference document.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment providing free text information related to the payment details.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments indicating the end of the details of payment and specifying hash total amounts for control purposes.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment identifying the end of the details of payment.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment indicating total amounts for control purposes.

segment.name: Control total
segment.documentation: CNT, A segment identifying the kind of control-checks for the payment orders contained in the PAYMUL and identifying the totals according to the coded form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments specifying the details of any authentication (validation) procedure applied to the PAYMUL message.

segment.name: Authentication result
segment.documentation: AUT, A segment specifying details of any authentication (validation) procedures applied to the PAYMUL message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment identifying the validation date/time.
